intro: Leptoloma coenicola, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in woodland and grassland habitats. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, which can be harmful if ingested in large quantities. Leptoloma coenicola is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 15 to 30 centimeters.
